VP.content: for Husserl, perception and symbolic representation, the phenomenological difference, is unbridgeable
VP.linkedContent: for Husserl, perception and symbolic representation, the phenomenological difference, is unbridgeable

VP.content: for Husserl, sensible, corporeal thing is a “sign for itself”; isn’t that the same as not being a sign? present to itself w/out indicative detour?
VP.linkedContent: for Husserl, sensible, corporeal thing is a “sign for itself”; isn’t that the same as not being a sign? present to itself w/out indicative detour?

VP.content: for Husserl, primary memory and primary anticipation are non-presences, non-perceptions, required for presence of perceived present [retentional memory is perception?]
VP.linkedContent: for Husserl, primary memory and primary anticipation are non-presences, non-perceptions, required for presence of perceived present [retentional memory is perception?]

FSW.content: when origin of memory and perceptual system are metaphorically united: “perceptual apparatus” must be writing machine
FSW.linkedContent: when origin of memory and perceptual system are metaphorically united: “perceptual apparatus” must be writing machine

FSW.content: most interesting analogy of Mystic Pad is time, a discontinuous time, time as spacing, withdrawal of perception, periodic non-excitability > interruption/restoration of contact
FSW.linkedContent: most interesting analogy of Mystic Pad is time, a discontinuous time, time as spacing, withdrawal of perception, periodic non-excitability > interruption/restoration of contact

FSW.content: if there were only perception, pure permeability of breaching, there would be no breaches (frayages), no legible writing, but pure perception does not exist: nous ne sommes écrits qu’en écrivants, par l’instance en nous qui toujours déjà surveille la perception, qu’elle soit interne ou externe ——we must be several in order to write, even to “perceive”
FSW.linkedContent: if there were only perception, pure permeability of breaching, there would be no breaches (frayages), no legible writing, but pure perception does not exist: nous ne sommes écrits qu’en écrivants, par l’instance en nous qui toujours déjà surveille la perception, qu’elle soit interne ou externe ——we must be several in order to write, even to “perceive”

F.content: cryptonomy is not purely verbal, but perception, like all mute pictures, falls under laws of cipher
F.linkedContent: cryptonomy is not purely verbal, but perception, like all mute pictures, falls under laws of cipher

DS.content: Mallarmé is more patient, subtle, discreet, efficient, does not suppress the double (make it dialectical, bringing us back to presence, to perception of the thing itself)
DS.linkedContent: Mallarmé is more patient, subtle, discreet, efficient, does not suppress the double (make it dialectical, bringing us back to presence, to perception of the thing itself)

DS.content: “center of presence” supposed to offer itself to perception/intuition (no perception when perpetual allusion/representation)
DS.linkedContent: “center of presence” supposed to offer itself to perception/intuition (no perception when perpetual allusion/representation)

P.content: via disinterest, nothing less aesthetic (sensory) than Kant’s aesthetic object
P.linkedContent: via disinterest, nothing less aesthetic (sensory) than Kant’s aesthetic object

OS.content: Heidegger: Kant’s transcendental aesthetic can’t perceive something actually present (Anwesenden), to perceive something Gegenwärtigen, one couldn’t intuit a single now (Jetzt), since each now has essentially continuous extension in just passing and just coming (in sein Soeben und Sogleich)
OS.linkedContent: Heidegger: Kant’s transcendental aesthetic can’t perceive something actually present (Anwesenden), to perceive something Gegenwärtigen, one couldn’t intuit a single now (Jetzt), since each now has essentially continuous extension in just passing and just coming (in sein Soeben und Sogleich)

OS.content: trace is its own erasure, belongs to trace to erase itself, eludes what would maintain it in presence, neither perceptible nor imperceptible
OS.linkedContent: trace is its own erasure, belongs to trace to erase itself, eludes what would maintain it in presence, neither perceptible nor imperceptible

CHM.content: no error in perception for Descartes, only in will of judgment [like Aristotle]
CHM.linkedContent: no error in perception for Descartes, only in will of judgment [like Aristotle]

Gii.content: Heidegger avoids reference to mirror of hands found in Kant [since Dasein only has a single hand], play of right & left > this difference can only be sensible
Gii.linkedContent: Heidegger avoids reference to mirror of hands found in Kant [since Dasein only has a single hand], play of right & left > this difference can only be sensible

AFR.content: for Condillac, time secures moment when object goes missing from perception, moment perception is absent from itself > moment space of signs opens, w/ function of imagination [time as that which absents perception?]
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, time secures moment when object goes missing from perception, moment perception is absent from itself > moment space of signs opens, w/ function of imagination [time as that which absents perception?]

AFR.content: Condillac: no philosopher has ever said sensations are innate
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac: no philosopher has ever said sensations are innate

AFR.content: for Condillac, error & obscurity only in judgment not perception
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, error & obscurity only in judgment not perception

AFR.content: for Condillac, repetition and absence of perceptual present to itself: gap or deviation of time > opens representative vection [desire] w/in sign & idea: suppléance as representation
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, repetition and absence of perceptual present to itself: gap or deviation of time > opens representative vection [desire] w/in sign & idea: suppléance as representation

SPEC.content: neither permanent traces nor resistance in [Freud’s] Perception-Consciousness (free circulation of energy w/out obstacle or binding), permanent trace supposes frayage (Bahnung) and an overcome resistance
SPEC.linkedContent: neither permanent traces nor resistance in [Freud’s] Perception-Consciousness (free circulation of energy w/out obstacle or binding), permanent trace supposes frayage (Bahnung) and an overcome resistance

SPEC.content: [Freud divided] Freud translating translation into scientific theory: 1) “trans-” inhabit origin on (dès) its very threshold 2) perception as prior to its translation
SPEC.linkedContent: [Freud divided] Freud translating translation into scientific theory: 1) “trans-” inhabit origin on (dès) its very threshold 2) perception as prior to its translation

SPEC.content: [re: Freud’s Beyond…] passage btwn transference & speculation > speculative transference orients, destines, calculates most original & most passive “first step” on very threshold of perception: desire for concept of perception belongs to destiny of this calculation
SPEC.linkedContent: [re: Freud’s Beyond…] passage btwn transference & speculation > speculative transference orients, destines, calculates most original & most passive “first step” on very threshold of perception: desire for concept of perception belongs to destiny of this calculation
